de.esoco.gwt.client.ui

Class AuthenticationPanelManager<C extends de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends AuthenticationPanelManager<?,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<C>
      • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerManager<C>
        • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.PanelManager<C,P>
          • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.AuthenticationPanelManager<C,P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoginHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GwtApplicationPanelManager

    public abstract class AuthenticationPanelManager<C extends de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends AuthenticationPanelManager<?,?>>
extends PanelManager<C,P>
implements LoginHandler
    A panel manager subclass that performs the authentication of users. It also implements the automatic re-execution of commands that have failed because a missing or expired authentication.

      • createLoginData

        protected static de.esoco.data.element.StringDataElement createLoginData(java.lang.String sUserName,
                                                                         java.lang.String sPassword)
        Creates a new data element containing the login data. The default implementation creates a string data element with the user name as it's name and the password as it's value. It also adds the user info created by createClientInfo() as a property with the property name AuthenticatedService.LOGIN_USER_INFO and an existing session ID (from the session cookie) with the property AuthenticatedService.SESSION_ID.
        Parameters:
        sUserName - The login user name
        sPassword - The login password
        Returns:
        The login data object

      • buildLoginPanel

        protected LoginPanelManager buildLoginPanel(de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<?> rBuilder,
                                            boolean bReauthenticate)
        Creates the login panel in the given container builder.
        Parameters:
        rBuilder - The builder to create the login panel with
        bReauthenticate - TRUE if the invocation is only for a re-authentication of the current user
        Returns:
        The LoginPanelManager instance

      • checkAuthentication

        protected void checkAuthentication()
        Checks whether the current user is authenticated. If not the login procedure will be initiated causing the login dialog to be displayed. On successful authentication the userAuthenticated(DataElementList) method will be invoked. Subclasses should invoked this method before performing an action that requires an authenticated user.

      • displayLoginDialog

        protected void displayLoginDialog(de.esoco.ewt.UserInterfaceContext rContext,
                                  boolean bReauthenticate)
        Creates a login panel and displays it in a dialog.
        Parameters:
        rContext - The user interface context to display the dialog in
        bReauthenticate - TRUE for a re-authentication of the current user

      • executeCommand

        protected <T extends de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>,R extends de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>> void executeCommand(Command<T,R> rCommand,
                                                                                                                              T rData,
                                                                                                                              CommandResultHandler<R> rResultHandler)
        Executes a certain command on the server.
        Overrides:
        executeCommand in class PanelManager<C extends de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,P extends AuthenticationPanelManager<?,?>>
        Parameters:
        rCommand - The command to execute
        rData - The data to be processed by the command
        rResultHandler - The result handler to process the command result in case of a successful command execution
        See Also:
        PanelManager.executeCommand(Command, DataElement, CommandResultHandler)

      • hideLoginPanel

        protected void hideLoginPanel()
        Hides the login panel. The default implementation hides the login dialog. Subclasses can override this panel to modify the login panel handling.

      • login

        protected final void login(boolean bReauthenticate)
        Will be invoked to perform a login if no user is authenticated. The default implementation will delegate the call to the parent or, if this instance is the root panel (i.e. the parent is NULL) it will invoke performLogin(boolean). Subclasses that want to modify the actual login should therefore override the latter method.
        Parameters:
        bReauthenticate - TRUE if this is a re-authentication because of an expired session

      • performLogin

        protected void performLogin(boolean bReauthenticate)
        Performs a login of a user by displaying a login form that is typically based on LoginPanelManager which will then execute the server-side login.
        Parameters:
        bReauthenticate - TRUE if this is a re-authentication because of an expired session

      • setLoginMode

        protected void setLoginMode(AuthenticationPanelManager.LoginMode eMode)
        Sets the login mode of this panel. If set to dialog the login panel will appear in a dialog view above the (initial) application view. Otherwise the login panel will replace the application view and the subclass must implement the method PanelManager.removeApplicationPanel().

        To change the login mode (the default is dialog mode) this method must be invoked before the login takes place. To change the login mode while the application runs it must be done while no login is in progress, e.g. after invocation of hideLoginPanel().

        Parameters:
        eMode - The login mode

      • userAuthenticated

        protected void userAuthenticated(de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList rUserData)
        Will be invoked to initialize this instance from the user data obtained through checkAuthentication(). Subclasses can override this method to perform user-specific initializations. The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rUserData - The user data received from the server
